qas.question: In 2000, how many families lived in Richmond?
As of 2000, how many people lived in Richmond per square kilometer?
What percentage of the Richmond population of 2000 was Pacific Islander?
What was the largest racial group in Richmond as of 2000?
In 2000, what percentage of Richmond residents were multiracial?

context: As of the census of 2000, there were 197,790 people, 84,549 households, and <a0_0>43,627<a0_0/> families residing in the city. The population density was 3,292.6 people per square mile (<a1_0>1,271.3<a1_0/>/km²). There were 92,282 housing units at an average density of 1,536.2 per square mile (593.1/km²). The racial makeup of the city was 38.3% White, 57.2% <a3_0>African American<a3_0/>, 0.2% Native American, 1.3% Asian, <a2_0>0.1<a2_0/>% Pacific Islander, 1.5% from other races, and <a4_0>1.5<a4_0/>% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 2.6% of the population.
